intro: Hieracium laevigatum subsp. placerophyllum, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite flower heads, typical of the daisy family. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often bluish-green in color. This subspecies is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows.
